info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 26 at 5:58PM EDT until June 26 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN LITCHFIELD COUNTY... At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Winsted, or near Torrington, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Litchfield County, including the following locations... Pleasant Valley, Mooreville, Riverton, Puddle Town, Pine Meadow, Beech Rock, Robertsville, Burrville, Barkhampsted Center and Bakersville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
